comment.author: 47327870@N00
comment._content:
Square dance?!? Looks more like Balboa (wikipedia.org):
"Balboa is a form of swing dance that started as early as 1915 and gained in popularity in the 1930s and 1940s. It is danced primarily in close embrace, and is led with a full body connection... The dancers stand close, touching from hip to upper chest... The man's right front torso (rib cage) touches the woman's center front torso (rib cage)."

comment.author: 29027889@N00
comment._content: That's not how I learned to square dance!  I would have to agree with WaiferX on this one.

comment.author: 60751299@N00
comment._content:
Could be balboa, or another early dance like the Peabody.  Given the year given (and the clothing seems to agree), I'd have to say balboa or a derivative.

A square dance is sometimes a "called" dance, so it could be truly a square dance where they called a move that just happens to look like balboa.   

Lots of possibilities.

comment.author: 23393335@N06
comment._content: Could be at what folks called a 'square dance', where there were some 'called' square dances [Honolulu Baby, Just Because, Red River Gal, etc.] and also quite a few waltzes, foxtrots, polkas, interspersed.

comment.author: 8291950@N02
comment._content: I know Balboa when I see it  :D
